boat.construction_details: 1" oak planking on 1" and 3/4" oak ribs.
boat.full_description:
'Coral' was one of six yachts built in Ipswich, 1936. She was taken to Ireland after the 2nd World War by a retired major who sold her on to Mark Sheehan and was kept in Westport until 2003.

She had a new engine fitted proir to 2003. Her mast is hinged on a tabernacle and her mainsail is roller reefed. She has a large pig iron keel weighing approximately 3/4 of a tonne.

No major cruises are known before 2003.
boat.name: Coral
boat.short_description: Built as one of six yachts in Ipswich, 1936, 'Coral' was taken to Ireland after the 2nd World War where she remains.
